fi.grimripper.loww.tiles

Class TileGrid.LineHelper<T extends Tile>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.tiles.TileGrid.LineHelper<T>
  • Enclosing class:
    TileGrid<T extends Tile>

    public abstract static class TileGrid.LineHelper<T extends Tile>
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains parameters and methods for selecting tiles along a direct line. Calculates the parameters of a direct line from starting tile to destination tile. Based on the line's parameters, selects the two closest directions from those associated with a tile's sides.

    On a direct line of tiles, the helper needs to pick only one direction, and one tile per step. If the line doesn't go directly along a straight line of tiles, two tiles are needed per step. When there are two, the better option can be selected by calculating the distance from the tile's center to the actual direct line.

    Author:
    Marko Tuominen

    • Method Detail

      • nextTiles

        public void nextTiles()
        Selects next pair of tiles along the line. The secondary tile can be null after the selection when the line is near a grid edge. Also selects the better option of the next two tiles, if appropriate. The other tile is also prepared for retrieval through getBetterTile(boolean). In most cases, there are two options. Then the distance of each option's center to the line is calculated. The preferred tile is the one with the shorter distance to the line. In a case where there's only one tile that the line passes through, it is selected and the other tile will be null. In some cases, the two tiles can be equal. If the preferred tile is an imaginary one outside the tile grid, the preferred tile will be null. The other tile can in this case be something other than a null.

      • targetReached

        public boolean targetReached()
        Checks if the current primary tile is the target.
        Returns:
        the target tile is on the current step

      • pathEnds

        public boolean pathEnds()
        Checks if the line has reached a tile grid edge and can proceed no further.
        Returns:

      • getNextTile

        public T getNextTile(boolean primary)
        Gets one of the next tiles. Preference between these hasn't been determined, and either one can be completely off the line.
        Parameters:
        primary - true for primary, false for secondary
        Returns:
        one of the next tiles (can be null at the edge of the tile grid, or if line goes along a straight line of tiles)

      • getBetterTile

        public T getBetterTile(boolean better)
        Gets the better of the two tiles on the current step based on closeness to the line. The worse option can be null, in case the tile is one that doesn't intersect the line, or an imaginary one outside the tile grid, or the line goes along a straight line of tiles. The primary tile can also be null if an imaginary tile outside the grid is closer to the line than an alternative that's on the grid.
        Parameters:
        better - true for better tile, false for the other
        Returns:
        the tile closer to the line, or the tile further away from it

      • tilesAreEqual

        public boolean tilesAreEqual()
        Checks if the current two tiles have equal distance to the line.
        Returns:
        current two tiles have equal distance to the line

      • determineLineDirections

        protected abstract Direction[] determineLineDirections(T from,
                                  T to,
                                  double xDiff,
                                  double yDiff)
        Determines directions for default line handling. There are normally two directions, one of which is selected on each step. If the line goes along a straight line of tiles, then only one direction is necessary.
        Parameters:
        from - the line's starting tile
        to - the line's destination tile
        xDiff - difference between the tiles' x-coordinates (positive if target is to the east)
        yDiff - difference between the tiles' y-coordinates (positive if target is to the south)
        Returns:
        primary and secondary direction for selecting tiles (secondary can be null for a line along a straight line of tiles)

      • estimateCenter

        protected abstract Point estimateCenter(Point fromCenter,
                   Direction toDir)
        Estimates the center point of a tile based on a neighbor's center.
        Parameters:
        fromCenter - estimate center relative to this center
        toDir - estimate center of neighbor to this direction
        Returns:
        the estimated center point
